image.altText: Police and ambulance vehicles gather in Bray Park

image.altText: Albanese stands speaking to media from a courtyard.

image.altText: Old man with grey hair and button up shirt

title.children: Family calls for witnesses after 87-year-old John Campbell Kerr's death at Noosa Heads

image.altText: A woman smiling with two kids.

title.children: The D'souzas tried out a financial adviser's best tips for saving money. Here's what they learned

image.altText: A smiling man wearing a cap.

items.synopsis: The mother of autistic man Luke Fergusson missing in Queensland's South Burnett bush vows to continue the search for her son as police scale back their own search efforts.

title.children: Search for autistic man missing in Queensland's South Burnett bush scaled back

image.altText: A green, glowing hospital cross sign outside a pharmacy

items.synopsis: Pharmacists in rural communities say they "won't be able to protect communities" against further medicine shortages from the 60-day prescription scheme as a new report claims huge losses for the industry.

items.synopsis: A rugby league player from the NSW Hunter Valley has died after a tackle during a game at Port Stephens on the weekend.

title.children: 'Kindest soul': NSW rugby league player dies after on-field tackle

image.altText: Greyhound legs and lower torso while the animal is running.

items.synopsis: Three South Australian greyhound trainers are handed life bans after being found to have been involved in live baiting.

title.children: Life bans, 'largest fines ever' for SA greyhound trainer trio involved in live baiting

image.altText: RBA governor Philip Lowe speaks at the Morgan Stanley Australia summit in Sydney

items.synopsis: Price caps on gas and energy bill subsidies may be lowering inflation. Can we do more things like that, instead of just raising interest rates?

title.children: Economists tell how to lower inflation without raising interest rates

image.altText: A man looks dejected after losing a second State of Origin match

items.synopsis: With New South Wales heading to Queensland on the brink of losing another series, the Blues will need their embattled skipper to produce another legendary Origin night, wites Nick Campton.

title.children: With NSW facing Origin oblivion, can Tedesco summon greatness one more time?

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

items.synopsis: A 31-year-old man pleads guilty to choking two teenagers in retaliation for a slapping game gone wrong, in which he believed his stepson was hurt.

title.children: Canberra man pleads guilty to choking two 13-year-olds in retaliation for slapping game gone wrong

image.altText: Alexandra Collier, with red lipstick, slight smile, and floral shirt, faces camera in close shot.

items.synopsis: The number of people choosing to start a family on their own is on the rise in Australia. Meet two women who followed different paths into solo parenthood.

title.children: 'I left a very good and happy relationship': Alexandra's partner didn't want a baby, so she did it alone

image.altText: A man and a woman walk on beach at sunrise. They are almost silhouetted by the sky behind them.

items.synopsis: Hosts of short-term accommodation platforms like Airbnb are shifting back to renting out their properties for longer terms as the rising cost of living dampens people's appetite for holidays.

title.children: 'Emotional decision': Property owners putting Airbnbs onto the rental market

image.altText: Pat Cummins holds his arms out and looks skyward as Cam Green completes a catch in the foreground

title.children: Storm clouds inspire Australia's most thrilling spell, and set up potential Edgbaston classic

image.altText: man smiling

items.synopsis: Emergency services are on their way to Rory Lane after he went missing from a popular walking track on Saturday.

title.children: Man reported missing in Lamington National Park found badly injured after three-day search

image.altText: A man reads from paper in front of micrphones with two women either side of him.

items.synopsis: The football club that lost five of its members in last week's Hunter Valley bus crash has spoken publicly for the first time since the tragedy.

title.children: 'Unfathomable heartache': Singleton Roosters speak a week on after fatal Hunter Valley bus crash

image.altText: Four men in suits at a desk raise their hands

items.synopsis: Top North Korean officials have labelled their botched attempt to launch a spy satellite their "most serious" shortcoming this year and vowed to make a second attempt soon.

title.children: North Korean officials vow to launch another spy satellite after failed attempt

image.altText: A police officerr in uniform and high-vis vest holding an rbt unit.

items.synopsis: More than 880 motorists were caught drink driving more than once in 2022, including 15 drivers detected flouting the rules four times and three drivers nabbed five times or more.

title.children: Drink driving offences rise in Queensland, thousands ordered to fit interlocks under new rules

image.altText: Ben Hunt warming up before a St George Illawarra NRL match in 2022.

items.synopsis: St George Illawarra CEO Ryan Webb said he had been left "surprised" by captain Ben Hunt's requests for an immediate release but hoped to "turn him around."

title.children: Dragons CEO blindsided by Hunt's contract release request, doubles down on retaining him

image.altText: Cassandra Dinkelman holds her son George, who has Down syndrome

items.synopsis: Life with kids means less sleep — especially for the half a million Australian children living with a neurodisability — but a new study hopes to change that.

title.children: 'Distressing': Sleep study explores difficulties children with neurodisability have when getting rest

image.altText: A smiling golfer holds a large silver trophy in the air as people applaud in the background.

items.synopsis: Wyndham Clark claims his first major after a rollercoaster back-nine battle with Rory McIlroy.

title.children: American Wyndham Clark wins US Open after rollercoaster battle with Rory McIlroy

image.altText: A shirtless man gets out of a pool.

items.synopsis: Cody Simpson and Mack Horton miss out on spots in the Australian swim team for the world champs, as the son of Hayley Lewis makes it in.

title.children: Son of a gun in, former pop star out as Australia names its team for world swimming champs

image.altText: Two middle eastern men embrace as one cries into the other's shoulder.

items.synopsis: As many as 750 men, women and children from Syria, Egypt, the Palestinian territories and Pakistan were on the vessel, trying to reach relatives in Europe.

title.children: Pakistan declares day of mourning for victims of shipwreck off Greece

image.altText: A batter walks off dejected as a bowler yells in celebration.

items.synopsis: England bowler Ollie Robinson appears to say 'f*** off, you f***ing prick' to Usman Khawaja after finally getting the Aussie opener out in the Ashes.

title.children: 'I don't really care': Robinson defends expletive-laden send-off after bowling Khawaja

image.altText: A composite image of Mark, Leigh and Shaun.

items.synopsis: The nominees for the 63rd TV Week Logies are out, with three ABC personalities set to go head to head for the coveted Gold Logie for the first time in history.

title.children: 2023 Logie Award nominations: Leigh Sales in the running for top honour

image.altText: Aerial photo of a car with its roof removed.

items.synopsis: The images taken from above the Kakhovka Dam show Russia had the means, motive and opportunity to bring down the structure.

title.children: Drone footage appears to show explosive-rigged car atop Ukrainian dam before collapse

image.altText: The PwC logo is shown on an office building.

items.synopsis: PwC confirms it has been affected by the MOVEit Transfer cyber hack, while the Australian dollar is closing in on 70 US cents as another RBA rate rise is considered a done deal. Follow the latest financial news and analysis on our markets live blog.

title.children: PwC caught up in global data breach, Aussie dollar closes in on 70 US cents, ASX opens higher

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: PwC is just the latest global firm to disclose that they have been impacted by the MOVEit Transfer software. Last week, the US Department of Energy and other federal agencies were affected through the file transfer software, while other global companies including Shell, British Airways and the BBC have also fallen victim to the attack. Hackers used a flaw in the MOVEit software to gain access to confidential data, but the Russian-linked group who had previously claimed responsibility hasn't commented on the US or PwC hacks. You can read more about the US federal agencies which have been affected by the hack below:
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: PwC isn't the only global company caught up in the MOVEit hack

featuredLink.title: US energy department, other federal agencies hit in global hacking spree

children.content: PwC is just the latest global firm to disclose that they have been impacted by the MOVEit Transfer software.

Last week, the US Department of Energy and other federal agencies were affected through the file transfer software, while other global companies including Shell, British Airways and the BBC have also fallen victim to the attack.
Hackers used a flaw in the MOVEit software to gain access to confidential data, but the Russian-linked group who had previously claimed responsibility hasn't commented on the US or PwC hacks.
You can read more about the US federal agencies which have been affected by the hack below:

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The Australian share market has built on its modest early gains, and now looks set to match or exceed Friday's Wall Street gains. The ASX 200 index is up 0.5% at 7,288 points, with the broader All Ordinaries rising 0.4% to 7,483. The healthcare and biotech sector is dominating the gains, with Polynovo, CSL and Fisher and Paykel Healthcare all among the top 10 gains. A 2.5% surge for Woolworths was also boosting the broader market. The resource sectors were the major drags, with both mining and energy losing ground. Top five gains: Abacus Property Group: +6.8% to $2.755 Star Entertainment: +5.2% to $1.105 Domino's Pizza: +2.9% to $45.17 Johns Lyng: +2.9% to $5.99 Polynovo: +2.7% to $1.545 Bottom five losses: Lake Resources: -15.3% to $0.4025 Syrah Resources: -5.2% to $0.8625 Liontown Resources: -5.1% to $2.99 New Hope Corporation: -4.7% to $5.46 Chalice Mining: -4.2% to $6.79
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: ASX extends gains at midday

children.content: The Australian share market has built on its modest early gains, and now looks set to match or exceed Friday's Wall Street gains.
The
ASX 200 index is up 0.5% at 7,288 points
, with the broader
All Ordinaries rising 0.4% to 7,483
The healthcare and biotech sector is dominating the gains, with
Polynovo, CSL and Fisher and Paykel Healthcare
all among the top 10 gains.
A
2.5% surge for Woolworths
was also boosting the broader market.
The resource sectors were the major drags, with
both mining and energy losing ground
Top five gains:

New Hope Corporation: -4.7% to $5.46

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: As if PwC did not have enough of its own problems, news has broken that the consulting and accountancy firm is one of hundreds of organisations to be affected by a major cyber hack. PwC has just released a statement saying the impact on it is relatively minor and few of its clients are affected. "We are aware that MOVEit, a third party transfer platform, has experienced a cybersecurity incident which has impacted hundreds of organisations including PwC. PwC uses the software with a limited number of client engagements. "As soon as we learned of this incident we stopped using the platform and started our own investigation. "Our investigation has shown that PwC's own IT network has not been compromised and that MOVEit's vulnerability had a limited impact on PwC. We have reached out to the small number of clients whose files were impacted to discuss the incident. "Data security is a key priority for PwC and we continue to put the right resources and safeguards in place to protect our network." It never rains but it pours. For more on the MOVEit hack, ABC News and Reuters had this story on Friday evening.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: PwC caught up in global cyber hack

featuredLink.title: US energy department, other federal agencies hit in global hacking spree

children.content: As if PwC did not have enough of its own problems, news has broken that the consulting and accountancy firm is one of hundreds of organisations to be affected by a major cyber hack.
PwC has just released a statement
saying the impact on it is relatively minor and few of its clients are affected.
"We are aware that
MOVEit, a third party transfer platform
, has experienced a cybersecurity incident which has impacted hundreds of organisations including PwC.
PwC uses the software with a limited number of client engagements
"As soon as we learned of this incident we stopped using the platform and started our own investigation.
"Our investigation has shown that
PwC's own IT network has not been compromised
and that MOVEit's vulnerability had a limited impact on PwC. We have reached out to the small number of clients whose files were impacted to discuss the incident.
"Data security is a key priority for PwC and we continue to put the right resources and safeguards in place to protect our network."
It never rains but it pours.
For
more on the MOVEit hack, ABC News and Reuters
had this story on Friday evening.

image.altText: A man in orange high-vis stands behind a shiny metal machine.

items.synopsis: Barcaldine's population has been dwindling for years, but a new green energy powered industrial development hopes to create 500 jobs and boost local manufacturing.

title.children: Green light for 'transformational' renewables project luring big business, former locals to work in outback
